so, you meant connect locally /from/ your windows machine then, right?
the destination machine has to be running an ssh server. If you're going /from/ Linux /to/ Windows, the Windows machine needs an ssh server.
then you can't ssh from ubuntu into Windows. It doesn't work that way. The server is on the destination, always.
to be perfectly clear, you are on your Windows machine, and you want to access a remote shell to your Linux box, right?

and that doesn't ping: that means it sent a ping, but didn't get an answer.
